metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45463 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
load_cache in GEGL before 0.4.34 allows shell expansion when a pathname in a constructed command line is not escaped or filtered. This is caused by use of the system library function for execution of the ImageMagick convert fallback in magick-load. NOTE: GEGL releases before 0.4.34 are used in GIMP releases before 2.10.30; however, this does not imply that GIMP builds enable the vulnerable feature.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45463` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gegl - 0.3.30-1ubuntu1+esm1
gir1.2-gegl-0.3 - 0.3.30-1ubuntu1+esm1
libgegl-0.3-0 - 0.3.30-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gegl package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.30-1ubuntu1+esm1').
